title: Pointer equality of ZST in debug build is inconsistent with that in release build
body:
Consider this code:

```rust
fn main() {
    let a = ();
    let b = ();
    dbg!(std::ptr::eq(&a, &b));
}
```

It will output `false` in debug build, but `true` in release build.

I've tried other Zero-Sized Types (ZST), like an empty array and a struct with no field, and the result is still the same.

Interestingly, the code below will consistently output `false` in both debug build and release build:

```rust
fn main() {
    let a = ();
    let b = ();
    dbg!((&a as *const _) == (&b as *const _));
}
```

[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&code=fn%20main()%20%7B%0A%20%20%20%20let%20a%20%3D%20()%3B%0A%20%20%20%20let%20b%20%3D%20()%3B%0A%20%20%20%20dbg!(std%3A%3Aptr%3A%3Aeq(%26a%2C%20%26b))%3B%0A%20%20%20%20dbg!((%26a%20as%20*const%20_)%20%3D%3D%20(%26b%20as%20*const%20_))%3B%0A%7D)

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.51.0 (2fd73fabe 2021-03-23)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2fd73fabe469357a12c2c974c140f67e7cdd76d0

release: 1.51.0
LLVM version: 11.0.1
```

(Rust 1.51, 1.53, and nightly (2021-07-25) have this behavior.)
